title: How to Hide Your Steam Activity

steps.title: Go to https://store.steampowered.com/ and log in (if you're not already).
steps.content: Go to https://store.steampowered.com/ and log in (if you're not already). You can use any desktop web browser to do this. Changing this will only hide your Steam activity on your Steam profile. This does not include hiding the pop-up notification that others get when you launch a game; you'll need to hide the notifications from Steam chat.

steps.title: Click your username and select View profile.
steps.content: Click your username and select View profile . Your username is in the top right corner of the page and clicking it will prompt a menu to drop down. You'll see your profile when you click View profile .

steps.title: Click Edit Profile.
steps.content: Click Edit Profile . It's under your Steam level on the right side of the page. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Privacy Settings.
steps.content: Click Privacy Settings . You'll see this in the panel on the left side of the page. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the drop-down next to "Game details" and select Private.
steps.content: Click the drop-down next to "Game details" and select Private . Neither your friends nor the public will be able to see what games you've played or how long you've played them. [3] X Research source They also will not see your wishlist or games that you own. If you set your profile to "Private", no one will be able to see your profile page, which can be bad only if you use third-party services with your Steam account.

steps.title: Open Steam.
steps.content: Open Steam. The desktop app looks like the Steam logo and you'll find it on your Start menu or in the Applications folder. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Friends.
steps.content: Click Friends . You'll see this at the top of the Steam window next to Steam and View . Alternatively, right-click the Steam icon in the System Tray (Windows only) and click Friends . You can also click Friends & Chat from the main Steam window if you don't have your Friends & Chat window open. From the Friends & Chat window, click the downwards-pointing arrowhead next to your username and follow the rest of the steps. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Offline or Invisible.
steps.content: Click Offline or Invisible . Once you do this, notifications will no longer be sent out from your account. You can open up any game you want without sending a notification to your friends that you're playing! [6] X Research source

steps.title: Open Steam.
steps.content: Open Steam. The desktop app looks like the Steam logo and you'll find it on your Start menu or in the Applications folder. This will only prevent others from seeing the games in your Library, not what you've played, or how much time you've played it.

steps.title: Click Library.
steps.content: Click Library . You'll see this next to Store and Community .

steps.title: Right-click the game you don't want others to see.
steps.content: Right-click the game you don't want others to see. Your list of installed games and those in your library are in a list on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Hover your mouse over Manage and click Hide this game.
steps.content: Hover your mouse over Manage and click Hide this game . Although people who can still see your profile will still be able to see any achievements you've gotten in this game and how long you've played it, those who have access to your computer will not see this game in your Steam library. [7] X Research source Repeat these steps and click Remove from hidden to unhide the game from your library .
